document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Career and Technical Education

023B8A6250B14F78A76A563D715933CB.description: present the final product using a variety of media.

refine the design of the robotic or automated system to ensure quality, efficiency, and

5B92BF4B2B724E598124D5EAB9EE2E14.description: identify and improve quality-control issues in engineering design and production;

6CCC16D243BD4FA6AD2B13266F853ABD.description:

decisions;

95A1A6938ED84486BA2DDBD72C500E66.description: The student uses engineering design methodologies. The student is expected to:

effectors and their use in a robotic or an automated arm system.

B13EE79D90BD48D08B809FDF6493D806.description:

B584159B6DFC42D7B5890DB66085BE53.description: demonstrate knowledge of robotic or automated system arm construction;

The student develops an understanding of the characteristics and scope of manipulators,
accumulators, and end effectors required for a robotic or automated system to function. The
student is expected to:

B9D8F96B12C649CFBBA7F3F2FC48871B.description: use selection programming structures such as jumps, loops, switch, and case;

F8DA6E85C95047DABBEC4E80A6A4E2C4.description: create algorithms that evaluate sensor data as variables to provide feedback control;

23E6FB3FFAB7418FB8BCD66C4E8AC1BB.description:

5ABE56CDDDD14B53AE75C6814AF3F35F.description: use the impulse-momentum theory in the design of robotic and automated systems;

49526668880547F4B1DF488F772EE671.description:

85B90A8117F6447E8A5CE67C2D8ECA3F.description:
The student demonstrates an understanding of advanced mathematics and physics in robotic and
automated systems. The student is expected to:

E54ACBB9D2194881AF340DBC553A36A1.description:

3FE770814F2040E68F320D4FF38605B7.description: implement feedback control loops used to provide information;

0D23FF05C4AE478F9CB5FB8259902173.description:
troubleshoot and maintain systems and subsystems to ensure safe and proper function and
precision operation;

D84FE58D4C7942F3A5D2C80D3C438368.description:

7975BD9B0A7F4F568A49389AB7C86397.description:
The student develops the ability to use and maintain technological products, processes, and

A637DFB7E23C44209EF3270A45FF21E5.description: describe the results of negligent or improper maintenance.

F4389AEE9FC64962B02A097BC7ACFF32.description: employ established inventory control and organization procedures;

DC2B5DB2F6704F4CB5E7C28FB602BE0D.description: handle and store tools and materials correctly;

AA38EF6CD5C640A194DFB8CAD53801B0.description: comply with established guidelines for working in a lab environment;

80E21BB7792B414EA03960AE34D8D95F.description: dispose of hazardous materials and wastes appropriately;

72B3F491DC4A436896BD232F00A9CCC6.description:

15B9BED7675B4AAB94DDC2F5A413B114.description:

regulations;

A00B1177077345C7A4AB0EE71E924E5A.description: The student practices safe and proper work habits. The student is expected to:

AE9E479F3F7B4FE8BD1BF7167C50EEB7.description: translate and employ a Project Management Plan for production of a product.

66A69097F3434253852F73E3FE8E0A31.description: participate in the organization and operation of a real or simulated engineering project;

23C86FA328F445C7B1F96AFFE2A9F482.description: develop a project schedule and complete work according to established criteria;

9841287B0F754A64BDF6348D091396CE.description:
implement project management methodologies, including initiating, planning,

BF2FA52CC66442D19064F9A56088DCDC.description: The student develops skills of project management. The student is expected to:

26A643A7F7A54B3AA422D9384BC2AE5B.description: participate in establishing team procedures and team norms;

BFAB526392214F42ABB146CE4312F1CD.description: follow directions and decisions of responsible individuals of the project team;

8FA8D546FCCE403FA3C126E1E1CFF6BC.description: demonstrate an understanding of and discuss how teams function;

BB746BDA92A0433C9AF7039A0FB4112D.description:
The student learns and contributes productively as an individual and as a member of a project
team. The student is expected to:

6DA4505A1FC049A99734791029344ED7.description:
display, explain, and justify mathematical ideas and arguments using precise

921CBEBD19FD45C5A4CBFC02CB1746C0.description: analyze mathematical relationships to connect and communicate mathematical ideas;

B16CEA4C3FB048F4A8DE4AFDB5E87521.description: create and use representations to organize, record, and communicate mathematical ideas;

0EB53F70D7DE48E182DAEFAE9D5CED59.description:
communicate mathematical ideas, reasoning, and their implications using multiple
representations, including symbols, diagrams, graphs, and language as appropriate;

A6C4787A387B4FD3A50A8F2FB2B0B3AF.description: apply mathematics to problems arising in everyday life, society, and the workplace;

D775998CF2A44AFF9DB4E8F2DA671254.description:
The student uses mathematical processes to acquire and demonstrate mathematical understanding.
The student is expected to:

ECE6341C40A740AFA0B1288528B583B6.description: explore robotic engineering careers and preparation programs.

BE39E1CA647F41699B1E66EAD55564A0.description:
demonstrate effective oral and written communication skills using a variety of software
applications and media;

A249DFA2972D415EA28BB3736EF4782D.description:
demonstrate appropriate actions and identify consequences relating to discrimination,
harassment, and inequality;

08CB92B1D53549ACA2BA112DDA9D4323.description: demonstrate respect for diversity in the workplace;

E8AAD4B8A63C4C44B87E14B9CD3C1CAF.description:
discuss ethical issues related to engineering and technology and incorporate proper ethics
in submitted projects;

449D728F7FF04F488196E6690D7A78C0.description:
locate and report on governmental regulations and laws, including health, safety, and
labor codes related to engineering;

B467E5138BF04311A68645BD666EC682.description: identify and use appropriate work habits;

A21DA36BDB75462097A9C8DB158D93A7.description: recognize the principles of teamwork related to engineering and technology;

114778FBDC6E464E8A13DF185E72FBD4.description:
distinguish the differences among an engineering technician, engineering technologist,
and engineer;

ABB00D190E134926A76AB06910DD9854.description:
The student demonstrates professional standards/employability skills as required by business and
industry. The student is expected to:

152F96BB20164C3B8526F8C57E1AADB5.description:
Statements that contain the word "including" reference content that must be mastered, while those
containing the phrase "such as" are intended as possible illustrative examples.

7B5A55132ACF46E9BC0A8E45907BD162.description:
Students are encouraged to participate in extended learning experiences such as career and
technical student organizations and other leadership or extracurricular organizations.

DC80F06182EE4F95987578DC07994797.description:
The mathematical process standards describe ways in which students are expected to engage in the
content. The placement of the process standards at the beginning of the knowledge and skills listed
for each grade and course is intentional. The process standards weave the other knowledge and
skills together so that students may be successful problem solvers and use mathematics efficiently
and effectively in daily life. The process standards are integrated at every grade level and course.
When possible, students will apply mathematics to problems arising in everyday life, society, and
the workplace. Students will use a problem-solving model that incorporates analyzing given
information, formulating a plan or strategy, determining a solution, justifying the solution, and
evaluating the problem-solving process and the reasonableness of the solution. Students will select
appropriate tools such as real objects, manipulatives, paper and pencil, and technology and
techniques such as mental math, estimation, and number sense to solve problems. Students will
effectively communicate mathematical ideas, reasoning, and their implications using multiple
representations such as symbols, diagrams, graphs, and language. Students will use mathematical relationships to generate solutions and make connections and predictions. Students will analyze
mathematical relationships to connect and communicate mathematical ideas. Students will display,
explain, or justify mathematical ideas and arguments using precise mathematical language in
written or oral communication.

1FDD3D3908564CD8B9A7E69131CDB0B5.description:
In Robotics II, students will explore artificial intelligence and programming in the robotic and
automation industry. Through implementation of the design process, students will transfer
academic skills to component designs in a project-based environment. Students will build
prototypes and use software to test their designs.

48F48E2B1F684B708BC2E8EFCED6E586.description:
The Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) Career Cluster focuses on
planning, managing, and providing scientific research and professional and technical services,
including laboratory and testing services, and research and development services.

D23F9AB949994AF4B6663923EE1D5C9B.description:
Career and technical education instruction provides content aligned with challenging academic
standards and relevant technical knowledge and skills for students to further their education and
succeed in current or emerging professions.

A279B0D1072C4550BC5EF5240ECC7B12.description:
General requirements. This course is recommended for students in Grades 10-12. Prerequisite: Robotics I.
Students shall be awarded one credit for successful completion of this course.
